personal.PI_institution: Scripps Institution of Oceanography, University of California, San Diego

sample_preparation.other_growth_conditions: 0.5% yeast extract added to TSB media. Seed cultures were grown in TSB(Y) media for 36 hours. Then transferred to production culture (72 hours). No more than 500 mL in 2.8 L flask.

extraction_methods.other_extraction_parameters: Cultures adjusted to ~pH 4 before extraction. Ethyl acetate was dried down and then resuspended in MeOH before LCMS analysis.

instrumentation_methods.buffering: Water and acetonitrile with 0.1% formic acid
instrumentation_methods.other_instrumentation: Reverse phase C18 HPLC column (5 um, 250 mm x 4.6 mm). Samples were eluted over a 60 min method with a gradient from 10 to 45% acetonitrile over 15 min, 45 to 65% over the next 30 min, and then to 100% over 10 min. 100% acetonitrile was held for 1 min before concentration was dropped to 10%. Flow rate was 0.75 mL/min.

BGC_ID.BGC: MIBiG number associated with this exact BGC

BGC_MS2_links.known_link: Streptophenazine (spz) BGC. In the above links I have the native producing organism CNB091 where you can see production of the streptophenazines. I also have the spz cluster expressed in the heterologous host (Streptomyces coelicolor M1146-pCAP03-spz) with synthetic strong constitutive promoters added for expression. This is the M1146-pKDB03 metabolomics data file that is linked above. I don't have a genome for this besides the native CNB091 since it is a heterologous production example. I have still included here in case it is helpful.
verification: Experimentally validated with knockouts, heterologous expression, or other gene cluster manipulation
Experimentally validated with NMR and/or detailed MS/MS analysis
